column3: On average how many hours a week do you play video games? (mobile, console, pc, etc)
column4: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Challenge motivates me to play a game]
column5: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Completion motivates me to play a game]
column6: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Competition motivates me to play a game]
column7: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Status motivates me to play a game]
column8: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Exploration motivates me to play a game]
column9: State how much you agree with the following statements. [Story motivates me to play a game]
column10: Are you a student in the course SWEN422
column11: One a scale of 1 - 5 how much did you enjoy playing the game?
column12: If you played the complete game do you think the level map would give you good control to choose which levels/upgrades you played/got first?
column13: Considering the level map can be played in any valid order, how likely do you think you would replay the game in a different order of levels and upgrades?
column14: In some levels, there are sections that can only be reached after gaining certain upgrades. Would this motivate you to replay a level to complete it fully (ie gathering all coins in a level) after gaining the required upgrades?
column15: Knowing that there are secret sections that can only be found after playing the game further in some levels, how likely are you to explore levels again?
column16: Do you feel like the story blurbs on the levels would motivate you to play the game?
column17: Do you feel like the skin store would motivate you to play levels and collect coins?
column18: Do you feel like the level completion times, medals and leaderboard would motivate you to play a level multiple times to get a better time?
column19: After gaining upgrades how likely are you to replay a level with those upgrades to gain a better completion time?
column20: Was the game the right level of difficulty?
column21: When you died for any reason, was it clear, and was it clear why you died?
column22: Did the controls, ie WASD feel responsive and fair?
column24: Did you find the level map and its UI clear or confusing?
column25: Was there anything else in the game that was not very clear or confusing?
why was the snowman not playable immediately
How to use Double and Triple Jump was not clear. How to defeat enemies was not clear. Whether or not degrading blocks would re-spawn was not clear
column26: Game style was nice....sound track was kind bland...i would mute it

column25: The finish flag can be mistaken for a checkpoint flag

Upgrades where not clear and how they worked was not clear either(crossbow controls double jump edge jumping required hints)and sometimes it was hard to notice an enemy against the forested backgrounds

column26: Very good game, fun and enjoyable, would recommend to all my friends.

column25: The intro map should no be as zoomed out. The jump mechanics seemed to not be as responsive as they should have been.
column26: The level with the barrels needs tuning.

column25: Sometimes I didn't think I would hit an enemy and die but I did.
column26: I feel like there should be an easier way to res pawn in some levels, because sometimes I fell off the platform and went back to an earlier section of the level with no easy way to get back to the later checkpoint. This was very frustrating for me because it took me a very long time to get to the checkpoint.
